{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3414124,"name":"","username":"SirFire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sirfire/{size}/222590_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-08T15:42:40.206Z","cooked":"

Hello,

I’m trying to implement MegaTag2 localization into my code which is using YAGSL. The Limelight documentation states that I need to use the gyro rate, but for some reason I cannot figure out how to get it using the methods provided by the SwerveDrive class.
Here is a reference to the code in question in the Limelight docs:

if(Math.abs(m_gyro.getRate()) > 720) // if our angular velocity is greater than 720 degrees per second, ignore vision updates
{
   doRejectUpdate = true;
}

I have tried getting the gyro object from YAGSL using SwerveDrive.getGyro() which returns a type SwerveIMU which does not have a getRate() method. I have also tried assigning it to an AHRS object which does have the getRate() method, but I get a type mismatch error.

Also, on a side note, we only have a Limelight 1. Is it capable of MegaTag2 with any good accuracy, and will the Limelight 1 firmware return the data in the same way the LimelightHelpers library expects? (AKA is Limelight 1 compatible with the latest version of LimelightHelpers)

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-08-08T15:45:59.085Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":48,"reads":102,"readers_count":101,"score":260.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469640,"topic_slug":"how-to-get-the-gyro-rate-using-yagsl","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.limelightvision.io/docs/docs-limelight/pipeline-apriltag/apriltag-robot-localization-megatag2#using-wpilibs-pose-estimator","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Robot Localization with MegaTag2 | Limelight Documentation","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-get-the-gyro-rate-using-yagsl/469640/1","custom_user_title":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3414133,"name":"Curt Rozeboom","username":"BlueEpiphone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/blueepiphone/{size}/197122_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-08T15:59:17.463Z","cooked":"

Good news, this recently got added to the latest development version. Merge pull request #216 from FRC5010/dev · BroncBotz3481/YAGSL-Example@89f1801 · GitHub

github.com

BroncBotz3481/YAGSL-Lib/blob/2024/src/main/java/swervelib/imu/SwerveIMU.java

package swervelib.imu;

import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation3d;
import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation3d;
import java.util.Optional;

/** Swerve IMU abstraction to define a standard interface with a swerve drive. */
public abstract class SwerveIMU {

  /** Reset IMU to factory default. */
  public abstract void factoryDefault();

  /** Clear sticky faults on IMU. */
  public abstract void clearStickyFaults();

  /**
   * Set the gyro offset.
   *
   * @param offset gyro offset as a {@link Rotation3d}.
   */
This file has been truncated. show original

Are you on 2024.5.0.2?

Oh, perfect! I just updated to 2024.5.0.2 which looks like it’s the latest version available via “Manage Vendor Dependencies”, but I’m still getting “The method getRate() is undefined for the type SwerveIMU” when I try to run a simulation. I’ve restarted VS Code a couple times after updating, so I don’t know what the issue is.
I’m guessing that this update hasn’t been pushed to production yet, so I’ll just wait for that to happen!
